title: Domain 1.7: Given a scenario, apply application installation and configuration concepts.
content:
🖥️ System Requirements for Applications

  • 🧠 32-bit vs. 64-bit: 32-bit apps work on both OS types, but 64-bit apps require a 64-bit OS. Affects how much memory can be used.
  • 🎮 Graphics: Dedicated GPUs offer better performance for gaming and 3D apps, while integrated graphics are lower-power and built into the CPU.
  • 🧮 VRAM: Required for high-resolution displays, video editing, and 3D modeling.
  • 🛏️ RAM: More RAM improves multitasking. Check app minimum and recommended specs (e.g., 8GB+ for design tools).
  • ⚙️ CPU: Some apps require multiple cores or specific CPU types (Intel, AMD, ARM).
  • 🔐 Hardware Tokens: Some enterprise apps require USB authentication devices.
  • 💾 Storage: Ensure there's enough space for install and updates.

🧩 OS Requirements for Applications

  • 🖥️ Compatibility: Check if the app supports your OS version (Windows 10 vs. Windows 11).
  • 🔢 32-bit vs. 64-bit OS: 64-bit OS runs both 32- and 64-bit apps; 32-bit OS can't run 64-bit apps.

📦 Distribution Methods

  • 💿 Physical Media: CD/DVD installs — less common today.
  • 🌐 Downloadable: Faster access and updates, but requires internet.
  • 🗂️ ISO Mounting: Mount ISO files to simulate physical discs for installs without drives.

🧠 Other Considerations for New Applications

  • 📱 Device Impact: Will it slow performance or use too many resources?
  • 🌐 Network Impact: Apps with auto-updates or cloud sync may affect bandwidth.
  • 🔄 Workflow Impact: Could it interfere with other apps or change how users work?
  • 🏢 Business Impact: Consider cost, licensing, training needs, and security implications.
